text.text: How do I remove a patient from my billing records?

text: To remove a patient from your billing records, you can click the trash can icon on the patient's line in the Patients tab. You can also reinstate a removed patient by clicking the Reinstate button.

text.text: Where can I find the option to remove a patient?

text: To remove a patient, you can click the trash can icon on the patient's line in the Patients tab. You can also reinstate a removed patient by clicking the Reinstate button.

text.text: What steps do I take to confirm the removal of a patient?

text: To remove a patient, you can click the trash can icon on the patient's line in the Patients tab. You can also reinstate a removed patient by clicking the Reinstate button.

text.text: Can I reinstate a patient after I've removed them?

text: To reinstate a removed patient, you can click the Reinstate button. You can also find the patient you want to reinstate in the Removed patients section.

text.text: How do I access the list of removed patients for reinstatement?

text: To access the list of removed patients, you can click the Removed patients link at the top right corner of the Patients tab. You can also find the patient you want to reinstate in the Removed patients section.

text.text: What is the process for locating a removed patient for reinstatement?

text: To remove a patient, you can click the trash can icon on the patient's line in the Patients tab. You can also reinstate a removed patient by clicking the Reinstate button. You can also find the patient you want to reinstate in the Removed patients section.

text.text: Is there a specific section in ZOLL Billing where removed patients are listed?

text: When an account is manually suspended, the following things happen: ZOLL Billing will no longer generate patient invoices on existing claims associated with this account. You can continue to post to this account. To remove the suspension, click "Send another statement".

text.text: How do I confirm the reinstatement of a previously removed patient?

text: To confirm the reinstatement of a previously removed patient, you can click the Reinstate button. You can also find the patient you want to reinstate in the Removed patients section.

text.text: Are there any restrictions on reinstating a patient?

text: When a patient is reinstated, the account displays under the "Final statement sent" tab on the Patient Billing page.

text.text: Can I reinstate multiple patients at once, or is it a one-by-one process?

text: You can reinstate multiple patients at once by using the Reinstate button. You can also find the patient you want to reinstate in the Removed patients section.

text.text: What happens to the patient's data and records when they are removed?

text: When a patient is removed, their data and records are moved to the Removed patients section.

text.text: Can I search for a specific removed patient by name or other criteria?

text: You can search for a specific removed patient by name or other criteria. You can also use Advanced Search to find specific claims based on tags, exact claim balance, or claim in a certain profit center.

text.text: Are there any notifications or alerts when a patient is reinstated?

text: When a patient is reinstated, there is a notification icon that displays next to the Help link on every page. You can click the envelope icon to view messages concerning issues that caused a claim you submitted to fail validation.

text.text: How can I ensure that I've selected the correct patient for reinstatement?

text: You can find the patient you want to reinstate and click 5. You can also use Advanced Search to find specific claims based on tags, exact claim balance, or claim in a certain profit center.

text.text: Are there any consequences or implications to consider before reinstating a patient?

text: The status is suspended (not closed) which means you don't have to write anything off your books after performing this action.

text.text: Can I undo the reinstatement of a patient if it was done in error?

text: Yes, you can remove the patient from the list on the Final statement sent tab.

text.text: Is there a record or audit trail of patient removals and reinstatements?

text: Yes, there is an audit trail for patient removals and reinstatements. You can find the audit trail next to the Notes tab on the facility page.

text.text: What permissions do I need to have to remove and reinstate patients?

text: To remove and reinstate patients, you need to have the following permissions: Click Admin > Billing > User Groups > Add new user group > Enter the name of the user group > Scroll down to the " Billing roles & permissions " section > Check the permissions you want to give to this role > Click Save.

text.text: Are there any best practices or recommendations for managing removed patients effectively?

text: To limit the risk of incorrect patient data, the confidence score is based on matching the current patient information with the returned information. You can use your best judgment in determining if the returned information is correct.

text.text: how can i remove a patient?

text: To remove a patient, you can click Admin > Billing > Patients > On the line of the patient you want to disable, click the trash can. You can also reinstate a removed patient by clicking Admin > Billing > Patients > At the top right corner, click Removed patients > Find the patient you want to reinstate and click 5 > Click Confirm.
